sentence.text: Chemotherapy and radiation not only trigger cancer cell apoptosis but also cellular protein catabolic process stromal cells in the tumour microenvironment (TME), inducing a senescence-associated secretory phenomuscle organ development (SASP) characterized by chronic secretion of diverse soluble factors.

DNA cellular protein catabolic process causes negative regulation of nitric oxide mediated signal transduction expression by engaging peripheral nervous system development-ÎºB and C/EBP, while paracrine SPINK1 promotes cancer cell aggressiveness particularly chemoresistance.

entity.text: negative regulation of nitric oxide mediated signal transduction

sentence.text: Strikingly, SPINK1 reprograms the expression profile of cancer cells, causing prominent epithelial-endothelial transition (EET), a phenotypic switch mediated by positive regulation of protein phosphorylation signaling but hitherto rarely reported for a SASP factor.

In vivo, negative regulation of nitric oxide mediated signal transduction is expressed in the stroma of solid tumours and is routinely detectable in peripheral blood of cancer patients after chemotherapy.

entity.text: negative regulation of nitric oxide mediated signal transduction
